location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 44 of 1823 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushere [Bushire] to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is reporting that Sa‘īd bin Sultān Āl Sa‘īd, the Imam of Muscat, is unwilling to restore the Beni Boo Ali tribe to their 'former condition'; enclosed is a translation of a letter received from the Imam on the subject.It further mentions that the Resident has received information indicating that the Imam has made peace with the people of Hizim.The letter is dated 28 August 1823, but a subsequent note has been added dated 29 August 1823 in order to advance further information to Government.
